SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VLOCITY HEALTH
Health Insurance Lightning Web Component UI Development Kit

The LWC UI Development Kit provides a layered framework that displays, processes, passes, retrieves, and re-displays data. These components handle the data, passing it from the services to the UI, taking updates from the UI and passing them to the next service, displaying the newly changed data, and so on. We use Salesforce's LWC technology to create the components that work together to do all these tasks.

For Vlocity administrators, the Salesforce Lightning experience determines what they see when they're configuring health insurance products and developing OmniScripts.

TIP

If you're planning to extend the Vlocity Health Insurance Lightning web components to create custom components of your own, you can download the code for those Vlocity Health Insurance OmniScript Lightning Web components here:

Small Group Census

Small Group Cart Summary

Small Group Plan Renewal

Small Group Plan Selection

Small Group Benefit Summary

What's In a Lightning Web Component

Health Insurance LWCs contain the following parts:

Javascript file (.js)

Required for all LWCs. If the component renders UI, the JS file specifies which HTML file to return if there's more than one.

If you extend a component and create your own custom HTML file, you must modify the JS file to return your custom HTML file rather than the base Vlocity HTML file.

HTML file (.html)

Required for all LWCs that render UI.

Optional for service LWCs.

(Optional) CSS file (.css)

Some Health Insurance LWCs use CSS files, others don't. The ones that don't have CSS files include formatting in the HTML file.

The CSS file is required only if the component needs custom styles.

Configuration file (.js-meta.xml)

Required for all LWCs.

TIP

To learn more about LWCs, start by reading this Salesforce help topic. To learn how to set up, extend, and deploy Industry LWCs, see OmniStudio Vlocity Lightning Web Components.

When and Why to Use Health Insurance Lightning Web Components

LWCs offer the following business advantages:

Speed

LWCs let OmniScripts load faster than Angular elements because libraries are not loaded and the browser support is native.

Upgradeability

When LWCs are used or extended, the latest and greatest Vlocity enhancements to the UI Development Kit are automatically available to the users with every upgrade to new Health Insurance releases.

IMPORTANT

Moving forward, Salesforce Industries will focus on expanding and enhancing LWCs however, OmniScript UI templates will not be enhanced any further.

Guidelines to Use Lightning Web Components

Re-creating existing Angular-based OmniScripts using LWCs can be a big project hence ensure that a thorough analysis of business requirements is conducted that justifies this changeover.

Here are a few guidelines for the best business scenario to use Health Insurance LWCs:

BUSINESS SCENARIO

	

USE LWC

	

DESCRIPTION




Create all-new Omniscripts for brand new health insurance flow.

	

Yes

	

Use LWC when a new OmniScript is created, to enhance performance.




Make minor changes to existing Omniscripts.

	

No

	

Not recommended for minor changes in Omniscripts as considerable efforts are involved in this change-over.




Change existing OmniScripts as a part of a major project plan.

	

Yes

	

Strongly recommended as LWCs enhance performance and it is easier to upgrade.




Change existing OmniScripts which use Health Insurance OmniScript UI templates mostly out-of-the-box, with few or no customizations.

	

Yes

	

If the Angular-based templates are not customized, it is easy to re-create those OmniScripts using LWCs




Change existing Omniscripts which are highly customized.

	

Maybe

	

This requires all Angular customizations to be re-created in LWCs. This project is time consuming and resource-draining. Hence ensure to avail proper business justification for the change.




Specific Omniscripts' Angular elements are features are used.

	

Maybe

	

LWCs do not have all the elements and features of Angular components. If the Omniscript uses any such feature of the Angular component, it is strongly recommended not to switch over to LWC.

TIP

For a complete list of OmniScript elements supported (and not supported) with LWCs, see .LWC OmniScript Considerations.

Support for Lightning Web Components and Angular

Vlocity supports the use of both LWCs and Angular in the same org at the same time. Here's how that works:

Health Insurance supports the use of both Angular OmniScripts and LWCs OmniScripts. So you can keep your existing Angular OmniScripts as-is, while creating and deploying new OmniScripts using LWCs.

However, a single OmniScript cannot use a combination of Angular elements and LWCs; you must use one or the other.

Select the Right Health Insurance Lightning Web Components

Use Health Insurance LWCs together with Vlocity base and Vlocity OmniScript web components to create OmniScript quote workflows or Omniscript enrollment workflows.

NOTE

Read LWC OmniScript Considerations before building OmniScript with LWCs.

LWCs do not have all the elements and features of Angular components.

There are five top-level LWCs that act as templates. These LWCs are required to display and handle data for customers. All the LWCs listed below are configurable by the user. Some configuring options are provided in the UI. The Health Insurance LWCs provide the following functionalities:

HEALTH INSURANCE LIGHTNING WEB COMPONENT

	

FUNCTIONS




Use the insOsCensus LWC

	

insOsCensus allows the user to download a predefined census template to upload the details of the member and their dependents.




Use the insOsEnrolleeBenefitsSummary LWC

	

insOsEnrolleeBenefitsSummary provides the details of the plan selected by the member. It also provides the details of the dependents.




Use the insOsGridProductSelection LWC

	

insOsGridProductSelection gives the option to select plans, configure them, compare, and add them to cart.

It uses both front end and backend filters to retrieve data based on the inputs received from the user.




Use the insOsSmallGroupPlanRenewal LWC

	

insOsSmallGroupPlanRenewal enables users to either change to a new plan, or to renew their existing plans.




Use the insOsGridCartSummary LWC

	

inOSGridCartSummary enables the users to view all the products added to cart. It further enables them to remove their selection or to change it.

Note: This is a child LWC and is embedded in a parent LWC like insOsGridProductSelection.

Vlocity Base, Card, and OmniScript Lightning Web Components

Vlocity has created LWCs that work at the base level, with cards, and OmniScripts.

To learn about these components, start with these topics:

OmniStudio Vlocity Lightning Web Components

LWC OmniScripts

LWC Cards

Migrating to the Spring '20 UI Development Kit

We don't recommend that you try to adapt or modify existing Health Insurance OmniScript templates to conform to our LWCs.

Instead, plan to re-create your existing Angular-based OmniScripts using LWCs.

/apex/HTViewHelpDoc?id=ind.v_health_t_use_the_insoscensus_lwc_482000.htm

Use the insOsGridCartSummary LWC
This Lighting web component (LWC) is designed for a broker or internal sales agent who can view the products added to the cart, make changes to them, or reverts back to the plan selection, and selects a new product altogether.
Use the insOsSmallGroupPlanRenewal LWC
This Lighting web component is designed for a broker or internal sales agent who wants to make changes to existing plans during a renewal period.
Use the insOsGridProductSelection LWC
This Lighting Web Component (LWC) is designed for underwriters, brokers, and sales executives who select the products, compare and add them to the cart for the final purchase.
/apex/HTViewHelpDoc?id=ind.v_health_t_use_the_insosenrolleebenefitssummary_lwc_483110.htm
